div1.p: I can't see much of what I am writing, but I want to get in touch with you a again somehow.

I have just returned from Columbia, where I spent 6 six weeks reciting my stuff for the United Artists for record. The first album should be on
-2-
the market by June 1st, I understand. We recorded a mess of stuff, and it nearly did me up, I am still slacking much of the time.

I do want to hear from you. There must be some news; What of the Biography and the U. of Mo. Press? The book should have a real publisher;
(See 3)
Big things are brewing!!
21
-3-
It's a fine thing.

We have a new contract a for Black Elk movie, which may work out by July 31st. There are several bidders for rights — one recent one is for movie a commercial play. The popper came to see me at Columbia.
-4-
I'm trying to get started again on an second volume. Reviews have all been happy. It's not an autobiography so much as another Neihardt book, Hilda says.
Do write me and tell about yourself and Bower.
Does Bower know General Crook's short speech on Indian treaties?
